title: The Inefficiencies of the Latest Energy Code - Pro Builder
summary: The International Energy Conservation Code (IECC) aims to improve energy conservation in new buildings, but recent revisions have led to higher construction costs with minimal energy savings. The analysis of the 2021 IECC by Home Innovation Research Labs highlights unreasonable return on investments, with some measures taking over 100 years to recoup costs. The National Association of Home Builders (NAHB) is working to ensure that the upcoming 2024 IECC provides cost-effective solutions for meeting energy performance standards.
likely_naics_codes: ['236115 - Residential Building Construction', '236210 - Commercial and Institutional Building Construction', '541330 - Engineering Services', '541990 - All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services']
greenwashing: The article suggests that some provisions in the IECC, such as the requirement for minimum R-49 ceiling insulation, may be an example of greenwashing as they offer minimal energy savings while significantly increasing construction costs.

title: Chijet Motor Company Listed on NASDAQ - Yahoo Finance
summary: Chijet Motor Company, a developer of next-generation electric vehicles, was listed on NASDAQ on June 2, 2023. The company aims to provide cost-effective new energy vehicles to consumers in China and other developing countries.  Chijet's plans include development of several new products, including the FB77 electric sedan and the R9 PHEV hybrid SUV.

title: ITC SWOT Analysis (2024) - Business Model Analyst
summary: ITC Ltd., a diversified Indian conglomerate, has a strong presence in sectors like FMCG, agribusiness, hotels, paperboard, and IT. While its strengths include a diversified portfolio, strong brand equity, and extensive distribution network, weaknesses include dependence on the cigarette business, slow adoption of e-commerce, and high debt levels. ITC has opportunities to grow in the FMCG market, expand into emerging markets, and focus on health and wellness, but faces threats from intense competition, changing regulations, and rapid technological advancements.
likely_naics_codes: ['311111 - Tobacco Manufacturing', '311211 - Food Manufacturing', '551112 - Hotels (except Casino Hotels)', '322130 - Paperboard Mills']
greenwashing: The article doesn't mention any instances of greenwashing by ITC Ltd, it highlights their commitment to sustainable practices and their efforts to reduce ecological footprints.

title: Neochem Technologies: Driving Sustainable Innovations in the Textile Industry - The Textile Magazine
summary: Neochem Technologies, a chemical company focused on the textile industry, is expanding its global reach with a commitment to sustainable solutions. Their innovations include natural and biobased fabric softeners, a natural clay-based preparation agent, and a sustainable replacement for Acetic acid. They are showcasing these innovations at ITMA Milan 2023, demonstrating their dedication to environmentally friendly textile manufacturing.
product_or_process: Natural and Plant-based Ester Quats fabric softeners
greenwashing: The article does not present any evidence suggesting greenwashing practices by Neochem Technologies.

title: Blue Tree Phuket drives ESG Initiatives, Reinforces its Sustainable Entertainment Hub Status - Khaosodenglish
summary: Blue Tree Phuket, a comprehensive entertainment destination, emphasizes its commitment to ESG standards with initiatives like solar panels, electric vehicles, and water-saving technologies. title: Drowning in plastic: Over 75% of plastic produced between 1950 to 2017 become waste â€“ How big a monster have we created? - The Financial Express
summary: The article discusses the increasing global problem of plastic pollution and explores potential solutions through circular economy initiatives. Several companies, including Coca-Cola, Bisleri International, and Hindustan Unilever, are implementing programs to recycle, upcycle, and promote responsible plastic disposal. However, the effectiveness of these efforts is questioned, with concerns raised about the limitations of recycling, the potential for microplastic pollution, and the need for companies to explore alternative packaging materials.

title: Swaraj launches 'Target' range of light tractors aimed at the growing horticulture segment - Autocar Professional
summary: Swaraj Tractors, part of the Mahindra Group, has launched a new range of 20-30 horsepower tractors under the brand Target, aiming to tap into the fast-growing horticulture space. This launch is part of a larger product revamp at Swaraj, which plans to introduce five new platforms including electric and autonomous tractors. The company is also expanding its manufacturing capabilities with a third facility set to become operational in the coming quarters.
